intro: Ononis columnae f. calycina, commonly known as the calycine whitlow grass, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant features trifoliate leaves with hairy surfaces and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Native to rocky and arid environments, it is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils. Its botanical structure reflects its evolutionary adaptations to harsh, dry habitats.
